Hi,

The realm is provided by the server. It tells the browser what area of=

the website the browser is currently viewing, and allows the browser
to pa=
ss back it's credentials for that realm. A realm could be any string.

A fa=
ilure of Heritrix to match a realm with a credential should result
in a log=
 entry that describes what realm failed. You should be able to
copy/paste t=
hat realm into the deciderule.

The reason there is a realm string is it al=
lows the server to divided
the space into sections. So that a credential th=
at works for one realm
won't work for another.

Sometimes the realm is the =
word "Basic", other times servers use the
web masters e-mail address.

I'm =
not sure how to discover the realm using FireFox?

When I try to access a U=
RL using FireFox it that displays the
"Authentication Required" dialog. Whe=
re is says "Enter username and
password for ''". The text that is in quotes=
 might be the realm?

or it might be the root URL.

Either way, it's a stri=
ng provided by the server.
